## manually copy-pasted from: https://beta.ruff.rs/docs/rules/#ruff-specific-rules-ruf
# still waiting for this: https://github.com/astral-sh/ruff/issues/1773
Code 	Name 	Message

UP015 	redundant-open-modes 	Unnecessary open mode parameters 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP017 	datetime-timezone-utc 	Use datetime.UTC alias 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP018 	native-literals 	Unnecessary {literal_type} call (rewrite as a literal) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP019 	typing-text-str-alias 	typing.Text is deprecated, use str 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP020 	open-alias 	Use builtin open 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP021 	replace-universal-newlines 	universal_newlines is deprecated, use text 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP022 	replace-stdout-stderr 	Prefer capture_output over sending stdout and stderr to PIPE 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP023 	deprecated-c-element-tree 	cElementTree is deprecated, use ElementTree 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP024 	os-error-alias 	Replace aliased errors with OSError 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP025 	unicode-kind-prefix 	Remove unicode literals from strings 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP026 	deprecated-mock-import 	mock is deprecated, use unittest.mock 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP027 	unpacked-list-comprehension 	Replace unpacked list comprehension with a generator expression 	âŒ ğŸ› ï¸
UP028 	yield-in-for-loop 	Replace yield over for loop with yield from 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP029 	unnecessary-builtin-import 	Unnecessary builtin import: {import} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP030 	format-literals 	Use implicit references for positional format fields 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP031 	printf-string-formatting 	Use format specifiers instead of percent format 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP032 	f-string 	Use f-string instead of format call 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP033 	lru-cache-with-maxsize-none 	Use @functools.cache instead of @functools.lru_cache(maxsize=None) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP034 	extraneous-parentheses 	Avoid extraneous parentheses 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP035 	deprecated-import 	Import from {target} instead: {names} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP036 	outdated-version-block 	Version block is outdated for minimum Python version 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP037 	quoted-annotation 	Remove quotes from type annotation 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP038 	non-pep604-isinstance 	Use X | Y in {} call instead of (X, Y) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP039 	unnecessary-class-parentheses 	Unnecessary parentheses after class definition 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP040 	non-pep695-type-alias 	Type alias {name} uses {type_alias_method} instead of the type keyword 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP041 	timeout-error-alias 	Replace aliased errors with TimeoutError 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP042 	replace-str-enum 	Class {name} inherits from both str and enum.Enum 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
UP043 	unnecessary-default-type-args 	Unnecessary default type arguments 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
UP044 	non-pep646-unpack 	Use * for unpacking 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸

flake8-async (ASYNC)

For more, see flake8-async on PyPI.
Code 	Name 	Message
ASYNC100 	cancel-scope-no-checkpoint 	A with {method_name}(...): context does not contain any await statements. This makes it pointless, as the timeout can only be triggered by a checkpoint. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC105 	trio-sync-call 	Call to {method_name} is not immediately awaited 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC109 	async-function-with-timeout 	Async function definition with a timeout parameter 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸

ASYNC115 	async-zero-sleep 	Use {module}.lowlevel.checkpoint() instead of {module}.sleep(0) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC116 	long-sleep-not-forever 	{module}.sleep() with >24 hour interval should usually be {module}.sleep_forever() 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC210 	blocking-http-call-in-async-function 	Async functions should not call blocking HTTP methods 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC220 	create-subprocess-in-async-function 	Async functions should not create subprocesses with blocking methods 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
ASYNC221 	run-process-in-async-function 	Async functions should not run processes with blocking methods 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸

ASYNC251 	blocking-sleep-in-async-function 	Async functions should not call time.sleep 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸

flake8-bugbear (B)

For related settings, see flake8-bugbear.
Code 	Name 	Message
B002 	unary-prefix-increment-decrement 	Python does not support the unary prefix increment operator (++) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B003 	assignment-to-os-environ 	Assigning to os.environ doesn't clear the environment 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B004 	unreliable-callable-check 	Using hasattr(x, "__call__") to test if x is callable is unreliable. Use callable(x) for consistent results. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B005 	strip-with-multi-characters 	Using .strip() with multi-character strings is misleading 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B006 	mutable-argument-default 	Do not use mutable data structures for argument defaults 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B007 	unused-loop-control-variable 	Loop control variable {name} not used within loop body 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B008 	function-call-in-default-argument 	Do not perform function call {name} in argument defaults; instead, perform the call within the function, or read the default from a module-level singleton variable 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B009 	get-attr-with-constant 	Do not call getattr with a constant attribute value. It is not any safer than normal property access. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B010 	set-attr-with-constant 	Do not call setattr with a constant attribute value. It is not any safer than normal property access. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B011 	assert-false 	Do not assert False (python -O removes these calls), raise AssertionError() 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B012 	jump-statement-in-finally 	{name} inside finally blocks cause exceptions to be silenced 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B013 	redundant-tuple-in-exception-handler 	A length-one tuple literal is redundant in exception handlers 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B014 	duplicate-handler-exception 	Exception handler with duplicate exception: {name} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B015 	useless-comparison 	Pointless comparison. Did you mean to assign a value? Otherwise, prepend assert or remove it. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B016 	raise-literal 	Cannot raise a literal. Did you intend to return it or raise an Exception? 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B017 	assert-raises-exception 	{assertion}({exception}) should be considered evil 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B018 	useless-expression 	Found useless expression. Either assign it to a variable or remove it. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B019 	cached-instance-method 	Use of functools.lru_cache or functools.cache on methods can lead to memory leaks 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B020 	loop-variable-overrides-iterator 	Loop control variable {name} overrides iterable it iterates 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B021 	f-string-docstring 	f-string used as docstring. Python will interpret this as a joined string, rather than a docstring. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B022 	useless-contextlib-suppress 	No arguments passed to contextlib.suppress. No exceptions will be suppressed and therefore this context manager is redundant 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B023 	function-uses-loop-variable 	Function definition does not bind loop variable {name} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B024 	abstract-base-class-without-abstract-method 	{name} is an abstract base class, but it has no abstract methods or properties 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B025 	duplicate-try-block-exception 	try-except* block with duplicate exception {name} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B026 	star-arg-unpacking-after-keyword-arg 	Star-arg unpacking after a keyword argument is strongly discouraged 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B027 	empty-method-without-abstract-decorator 	{name} is an empty method in an abstract base class, but has no abstract decorator 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B028 	no-explicit-stacklevel 	No explicit stacklevel keyword argument found 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B029 	except-with-empty-tuple 	Using except* (): with an empty tuple does not catch anything; add exceptions to handle 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B030 	except-with-non-exception-classes 	except* handlers should only be exception classes or tuples of exception classes 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B031 	reuse-of-groupby-generator 	Using the generator returned from itertools.groupby() more than once will do nothing on the second usage 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B032 	unintentional-type-annotation 	Possible unintentional type annotation (using :). Did you mean to assign (using =)? 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B033 	duplicate-value 	Sets should not contain duplicate item {value} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B034 	re-sub-positional-args 	{method} should pass {param_name} and flags as keyword arguments to avoid confusion due to unintuitive argument positions 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B035 	static-key-dict-comprehension 	Dictionary comprehension uses static key: {key} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B039 	mutable-contextvar-default 	Do not use mutable data structures for ContextVar defaults 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B901 	return-in-generator 	Using yield and return {value} in a generator function can lead to confusing behavior 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
B904 	raise-without-from-inside-except 	Within an except* clause, raise exceptions with raise ... from err or raise ... from None to distinguish them from errors in exception handling 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B905 	zip-without-explicit-strict 	zip() without an explicit strict= parameter 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
B909 	loop-iterator-mutation 	Mutation to loop iterable {name} during iteration 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
B911 	batched-without-explicit-strict 	itertools.batched() without an explicit strict parameter 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸

PYI029 	str-or-repr-defined-in-stub 	Defining {name} in a stub is almost always redundant 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI030 	unnecessary-literal-union 	Multiple literal members in a union. Use a single literal, e.g. Literal[{}] 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI032 	any-eq-ne-annotation 	Prefer object to Any for the second parameter to {method_name} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI033 	type-comment-in-stub 	Don't use type comments in stub file 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸

PYI035 	unassigned-special-variable-in-stub 	{name} in a stub file must have a value, as it has the same semantics as {name} at runtime 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI036 	bad-exit-annotation 	Star-args in {method_name} should be annotated with object 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI041 	redundant-numeric-union 	Use {supertype} instead of {subtype} | {supertype} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI042 	snake-case-type-alias 	Type alias {name} should be CamelCase 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI043 	t-suffixed-type-alias 	Private type alias {name} should not be suffixed with T (the T suffix implies that an object is a TypeVar) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI044 	future-annotations-in-stub 	from __future__ import annotations has no effect in stub files, since type checkers automatically treat stubs as having those semantics 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI045 	iter-method-return-iterable 	__aiter__ methods should return an AsyncIterator, not an AsyncIterable 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI046 	unused-private-protocol 	Private protocol {name} is never used 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI047 	unused-private-type-alias 	Private TypeAlias {name} is never used 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI048 	stub-body-multiple-statements 	Function body must contain exactly one statement 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI049 	unused-private-typed-dict 	Private TypedDict {name} is never used 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI050 	no-return-argument-annotation-in-stub 	Prefer {module}.Never over NoReturn for argument annotations 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI051 	redundant-literal-union 	Literal[{literal}] is redundant in a union with {builtin_type} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI052 	unannotated-assignment-in-stub 	Need type annotation for {name} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI053 	string-or-bytes-too-long 	String and bytes literals longer than 50 characters are not permitted 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI054 	numeric-literal-too-long 	Numeric literals with a string representation longer than ten characters are not permitted 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI055 	unnecessary-type-union 	Multiple type members in a union. Combine them into one, e.g., type[{union_str}]. 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI056 	unsupported-method-call-on-all 	Calling .{name}() on __all__ may not be supported by all type checkers (use += instead) 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI057 	byte-string-usage 	Do not use {origin}.ByteString, which has unclear semantics and is deprecated 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI058 	generator-return-from-iter-method 	Use {return_type} as the return value for simple {method} methods 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI059 	generic-not-last-base-class 	Generic[] should always be the last base class 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
PYI061 	redundant-none-literal 	Literal[None, ...] can be replaced with Literal[...] | None 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
PYI062 	duplicate-literal-member 	Duplicate literal member {} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI063 	pep484-style-positional-only-parameter 	Use PEP 570 syntax for positional-only parameters 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI064 	redundant-final-literal 	Final[Literal[{literal}]] can be replaced with a bare Final 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PYI066 	bad-version-info-order 	Put branches for newer Python versions first when branching on sys.version_info comparisons 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
flake8-pytest-style (PT)

For more, see flake8-pytest-style on PyPI.

For related settings, see flake8-pytest-style.
Code 	Name 	Message
PT001 	pytest-fixture-incorrect-parentheses-style 	Use @pytest.fixture{expected} over @pytest.fixture{actual} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT002 	pytest-fixture-positional-args 	Configuration for fixture {function} specified via positional args, use kwargs 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT003 	pytest-extraneous-scope-function 	scope='function' is implied in @pytest.fixture() 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT004 	pytest-missing-fixture-name-underscore 	Fixture {function} does not return anything, add leading underscore 	âŒ ğŸ› ï¸
PT005 	pytest-incorrect-fixture-name-underscore 	Fixture {function} returns a value, remove leading underscore 	âŒ ğŸ› ï¸
PT006 	pytest-parametrize-names-wrong-type 	Wrong type passed to first argument of pytest.mark.parametrize; expected {expected_string} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT007 	pytest-parametrize-values-wrong-type 	Wrong values type in pytest.mark.parametrize expected {values} of {row} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT008 	pytest-patch-with-lambda 	Use return_value= instead of patching with lambda 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT009 	pytest-unittest-assertion 	Use a regular assert instead of unittest-style {assertion} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT010 	pytest-raises-without-exception 	set the expected exception in pytest.raises() 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT011 	pytest-raises-too-broad 	pytest.raises({exception}) is too broad, set the match parameter or use a more specific exception 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT012 	pytest-raises-with-multiple-statements 	pytest.raises() block should contain a single simple statement 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT013 	pytest-incorrect-pytest-import 	Incorrect import of pytest; use import pytest instead 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT014 	pytest-duplicate-parametrize-test-cases 	Duplicate of test case at index {index} in pytest.mark.parametrize 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT015 	pytest-assert-always-false 	Assertion always fails, replace with pytest.fail() 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT016 	pytest-fail-without-message 	No message passed to pytest.fail() 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT017 	pytest-assert-in-except 	Found assertion on exception {name} in except block, use pytest.raises() instead 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT018 	pytest-composite-assertion 	Assertion should be broken down into multiple parts 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT019 	pytest-fixture-param-without-value 	Fixture {name} without value is injected as parameter, use @pytest.mark.usefixtures instead 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT020 	pytest-deprecated-yield-fixture 	@pytest.yield_fixture is deprecated, use @pytest.fixture 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT021 	pytest-fixture-finalizer-callback 	Use yield instead of request.addfinalizer 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT022 	pytest-useless-yield-fixture 	No teardown in fixture {name}, use return instead of yield 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT023 	pytest-incorrect-mark-parentheses-style 	Use @pytest.mark.{mark_name}{expected_parens} over @pytest.mark.{mark_name}{actual_parens} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT024 	pytest-unnecessary-asyncio-mark-on-fixture 	pytest.mark.asyncio is unnecessary for fixtures 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT025 	pytest-erroneous-use-fixtures-on-fixture 	pytest.mark.usefixtures has no effect on fixtures 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT026 	pytest-use-fixtures-without-parameters 	Useless pytest.mark.usefixtures without parameters 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
PT027 	pytest-unittest-raises-assertion 	Use pytest.raises instead of unittest-style {assertion} 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸

RUF019 	unnecessary-key-check 	Unnecessary key check before dictionary access 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF020 	never-union 	{never_like} | T is equivalent to T 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF021 	parenthesize-chained-operators 	Parenthesize a and b expressions when chaining and and or together, to make the precedence clear 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF022 	unsorted-dunder-all 	__all__ is not sorted 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF023 	unsorted-dunder-slots 	{}.__slots__ is not sorted 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF024 	mutable-fromkeys-value 	Do not pass mutable objects as values to dict.fromkeys 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
RUF025 	unnecessary-empty-iterable-within-deque-call 	Unnecessary empty iterable within a deque call 	ğŸ§ª ğŸ› ï¸
RUF026 	default-factory-kwarg 	default_factory is a positional-only argument to defaultdict 	âœ”ï¸ ğŸ› ï¸
